speaker: Hunter's Trail
lines: Boot treads stitch the mud into a pattern that holds in the rain.
Feather tufts snag on thorn like commas left by a careful sentence.
A snare sits un-sprung and embarrassed under a fern.
You pass a marker: three notches in bark, one fresh, two patient.
A flask cork dangles from a string, smelling of apple and apology.
Your shadow walks thin under the canopy; it does not step on roots.
A low growl knots the air and waits to see if you tug.
Something clever watches from the blind where the trail goes quiet.

choices.text: Call out to the hunter you cannot see.
Stand your ground and draw steel.
Turn off the trail toward a darker stream.
